intro: Biscutella montana subsp. rosularis, commonly known as the Rosular Biscutella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The subspecies is characterized by its rosette-forming growth habit, with compact clusters of small, bright yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. This plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
